title: Count Set Bits
algorithmDescription: Count number of 1 bits in binary representation using bit operations
detailedDescription: Count number of 1 bits (set bits) in binary representation of integer. Input: A non-negative integer n. Output: Count of 1 bits. Use bit manipulation techniques. Brian Kernighan's algorithm: n & (n-1) removes rightmost set bit.
hints: Brian Kernighan: n & (n-1) clears rightmost set bit
Alternative: check each bit with n & 1, right shift
More efficient than converting to string
solutionApproach: Use Brian Kernighan's algorithm: initialize count=0. While n > 0: n = n & (n-1), increment count. Each iteration removes one set bit. Return count.
testCaseCriteria: Must use bit manipulation. Should handle 0, powers of 2, and numbers with all bits set.
